reg:regulation.reg:title:
Bare Land Strata Plan
Cancellation Regulation

bcl:definition.bcl:text: Act means the Strata Property Act;
approving officer means an approving officer as defined in the Land Title Act;
local government has the same meaning as in section 1 of the Schedule to the Local Government Act;
owner means an owner as defined in the Land Title Act.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: An application under section 274 of the Act to cancel a bare land strata plan must be in the form required by the registrar, and must include

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the date of deposit of the plan in the land title office, its number and the description of the land within the plan,
a statement as to whether the land is situated in a certain municipality or in a rural area,
a statement of the improvements to and the occupation of the land in the plan,
a statement of the assets, other than the common property, and the debts and liabilities of the strata corporation,
proposals for the vesting or other disposition of the land in the plan, including the common property and improvements, upon cancellation,
proposals for the vesting or other disposition of the assets of the strata corporation, other than the common property, upon cancellation,
proposals for the winding up of the affairs of the strata corporation, including the discharge of all debts and liabilities, and
the name, occupation and post office address of each owner and the description of the land owned by each owner.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: An application to cancel a bare land strata plan must, in addition to the documents required by section 274 of the Act, be accompanied by

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: all documents that are required to carry out the proposals for vesting or other disposition of the land in the plan, and
a copy of the notice referred to in section 2.1 of this regulation.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: Despite section 274 of the Act, an application to cancel a bare land strata plan need not be accompanied by a court order under section 273.1 or the written consent referred to in section 274 (c) (i) if

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the bare land strata plan has fewer than 5 strata lots, and

the registrar considers that the interests of holders of registered charges against land shown on the strata plan or land held in the name of or on behalf of the strata corporation, but not shown on the strata plan, will not be affected by the cancellation.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: An application under section 274 of the Act may not be made in relation to a bare land strata plan unless written notice is given, at least 90 days before the date of the application,

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: if any land within the strata plan is within the jurisdiction of a local government, to the local government, and
if any land within the strata plan is outside the jurisdiction of a local government, to the applicable approving officer under the Land Title Act.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: A notice under subsection (1) must be in Form BL-A and must

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: state whether the owners intend to apply for subdivision of the land within the strata plan, and

if the owners intend to apply for subdivision of the land within the strata plan, include a list of any common property or common assets that the owners propose to dispose to a local government or the Province.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: Subject to subsection (2), no bare land strata plan shall be cancelled unless

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the documents referred to in section 2 (3) (a) comply with the requirements of the Land Title Act,

the debts and liabilities of the strata corporation, other than debts held by holders of registered charges against land shown on the strata plan or land held in the name of or on behalf of the strata corporation, but not shown on the strata plan, have been extinguished, and
all taxes, assessments and charges levied on the owners of land within the plan have been paid.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: Where the documents referred to in section 2 (3) (a) include a subdivision plan, the registrar may receive but not deposit the subdivision plan prior to it being approved by an approving officer.
Subject to subsection (2), the registrar shall, upon receipt of an application that complies with the requirements of this regulation and the Land Title Act,

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: cancel the bare land strata plan,
register the documents referred to in section 2 (3) (a), issue a new certificate of title and amend the registrar's records accordingly, and
declare the strata corporation dissolved.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: Where an application to cancel a bare land strata plan complies with the requirements of this regulation and the Land Title Act but is accompanied by a subdivision plan that has not been approved by an approving officer, the registrar shall

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: approve the application, subject to approval of the subdivision plan by an approving officer, and
upon approval of the subdivision plan by an approving officer

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: cancel the bare land strata plan,
register the documents referred to in section 2 (3) (a), issue a new certificate of title and amend the registrar's records accordingly, and

bcl:centertext.in:strong: Notice of Intent to Wind Up a Strata Corporation and Cancel a Bare Land Strata Plan

in:em.in:em: (Bare Land Strata Plan Cancellation Regulation section 2.1)

bcl:schedule.bcl:lefttext: Re: Strata Plan ......................................................... [the registration number of the strata plan].

Notice is given of intent to apply to the registrar to cancel the above strata plan and to wind up the strata corporation pursuant to the Bare Land Strata Plan Cancellation Regulation and Part 16 of the Strata Property Act.
bcl:schedule.bcl:indent1: (a) Do the owners intend to apply for subdivision of the land within the strata plan?
(b) Do the owners intend to ask a local government or the Province to acquire common property or common assets from the strata corporation?

bcl:indent2.in:em: If yes, identify the common property or common assets as follows:

bcl:schedule.bcl:indent2: pipes and other facilities for the passage or provision of:
other on-site services or facilities: [please list]
bcl:schedule.bcl:lefttext:
................................................................
